Welcome to Professional Competencies

Please begin this module by reviewing the module handbook. You will find additional information such as the weekly schedule, learning methods, and essential resources. Students are responsible for reading the content of this document. For further information, contact your instructor

View module handbook

Module Outline

This pathway module will introduce students to a range of professional, personal, and study skills across various types of learning activities including lectures, group workshops, collaborative research projects, online formative assessments, and discussions.

By completing this module, you will acquire practical art and design knowledge, enhancing your ability to explore personal ideas and Students are required to review their lecture notes and undertake preparatory reading and research on assigned material in order to participate in class discussions individually and as part of a group.

Learning Outcomes

By the end of this module, you will be able to:

.

Use techniques for study, analysis, and reflection at university and elsewhere.

.

Work collaboratively within groups and teams and develop personal relationships.

.

Apply techniques to manage time, deadlines, and stress effectively.

.

Demonstrate knowledge of career planning, development, and employability.

Assessments

  • WEEKLY QUIZ: A series of 5 quizzes will be held each week and worth 15%25 of the overall grade

  • GROUP ASSIGNMENT: Group Presentation is worth 25%25 of the total grade

Assessment dates

Please note and manage your submission dates, they are important, and you must submit your assessments before the deadline. It is NOT possible to request an extension. The University will NOT send reminders if your submission is late or if you do not submit at all. If there are exceptional circumstances outside your control (for example, serious illness) affecting your ability to submit on time, you can download an Exceptional Circumstances (EC) formLinks to an external site..

Teaching team

.

Sandra Schneiderman

Ms. Sandra is Student Affairs Team Leader as well as a Teacher. She is the liaison between faculty and students to develop effective lessons and individual learning plans. Ms. Sandra got her Bachelor of Education and Master of Education at the University of Melbourne. In addition, she also holds a Postgraduate Diploma in Gifted Education (Monash University) and Reading; Literature (University of Melbourne). From 2014-2020, she taught the International Baccalaureate Program at the United Nations International School (Vietnam). Her curriculum utilizes Case Study and Active Learning methods, and masterfully combines multimedia social technology classroom instruction across all aspects of the continuous and summative learning process.

Contact

Email: sandra.s@buv.edu.vn

.

Paul Varagh

Paul received a degree in HR Administration from University of Guelph before returning to his home city of Toronto, Canada to complete a post-diploma in HR Management at Seneca College. Paul then worked in several countries in Asia and the middle east before going to England for an M.Ed at the University of Nottingham. After short stints in northern Africa and the middle East, Paul returned to Vietnam where he worked for RMIT before joining BUV.

Contact

Email: paul.v@buv.edu.vn

.

Julian Psomas

Julian discovered the field of hospitality while studying for his BA Hons in Marketing in Scotland, working in banqueting and bartending at St Andrews where he was lucky enough to become a team leader and serve members of the Royal family. He continued with an MBA in Hospitality Management in the prestigious L'Ecole Superieure de Savignac, and moved to Belgium, working for eight years in renowned international chains such as Hilton, Marriott, Rocco Forte and Sandton hotel, picking up experience in the wine and spirit business along the way and gaining a WSET 2 award in wines.

Contact

Email: julian.p@buv.edu.vn

.

Lee McMillan

Lee holds a TEFL, PGDBJ and an MA Degree in History from the University of Glasgow in her native Scotland. Lee moved to Vietnam in 2015 working as an IELTS teacher, examiner, and VTV4 presenter before starting her role at BUV in 2018, moving into Events, Marketing, and Tourism Management. Working also as BUV Academic International Partnership Advisor, Lee draws on her experience as a Broadcast Journalist and corporate Sales and Event Manager, helping her engage international partners and corporations, and continues to strengthen her corporate relationships here in Vietnam.

Contact

Email: lee.m@buv.edu.vn

week1.body:
Welcome to week 1

This first week aims to identify your learning style, to know yourself and your neighbours a bit better. At the end of the week, you should be able to create your future goals, write an email skilfully and give constructive feedback.

.

LESSON CONTENT

  1. Prework: Read Chapter 11 of the course textbook - Career.

  2. Class 1: Intro to the module, identify your skills.

  3. Class 2: Write an email and give feedback

  4. Class 3: Your goals / Summative Canvas Quiz

.

STUDY MATERIALS

  • Lecture Slides: Review this week's lecture ppt.

  • Article 1: Understanding the Difference between Constructive Criticism and Criticism.

  • Article 2: 10 Examples of Constructive Feedback in the Workplace.

  • Article 3: 8 Examples of Constructive Feedback.

  • Article 4: Is the workforce ready for reinvention?

  • Video 1: POMODORO TECHNIQUE - My Favorite Tool to Improve Studying and Productivity

  • Video 2: Gen Z is reshaping the future of work – here’s how

.

Ask questions, view comments, and get follow-up materials on the course noticeboard

week2.body:
Welcome to week 2

This week is all about time management. We'll look at techniques to plan better and use your time more effectively, and digital tools such as Microsoft Outlook and Quizlet. By the end of this week, you should have developed sytategies for managing time, tasks, and self-care. You should also understand the Power of habit, and be able to revise for tests.

.

LESSON CONTENT

  1. PREWORK: Reading - Learn how to beat time-wasting and bad planning in Chapter 2, 'Time'. Look for at least three skills you can use, and prepare to answer questions on this text.

  2. CLASS 1: Lecture - Learn key time management and organisational skills which will be useful at university, socially, and in the workplace.

  3. CLASS 2: Digital Skills - In this lesson, you will learn how to create a quizlet to learn faster and make review easier.

  4. CLASS 3: Review and practice - Work individually and in small groups to evaluate your week's learning and practice for your weekly quiz using the quizlet flashcards you created.

.

STUDY MATERIALS

  • QUIZLET: Get started with Quizlet here

  • LEARN: Get started with one of your most essential digital tools, Microsoft Outlook. Learn how to send and reply to emails, download attachments, and more!

  • PPT: Review this week's lecture ppt

  • WATCH: How To Simplify Your Life

  • ARTICLE 1: 16 Digital Detox Tips That Actually Work in 2023

  • ARTICLE 2: Time-management skills: definition, examples and tips for improvement

  • ARTICLE 3: How Are Habits Formed? The Psychology of Habit Formation

.

Ask questions, view comments, and get follow-up materials on the course noticeboard
